sen.j: 岩倉 具選（いわくら ともかず、 宝暦7年1月4日 (旧暦)（1757年2月21日） – 文政7年7月7日 (旧暦)（1824年8月1日））は、江戸時代中期・後期の日本の公卿。
sen.e: Tomokazu IWAKURA (February 21, 1757-August 1, 1824) was a Japanese Kugyo (high court noble) in the mid through late Edo period.
Tomokazu IWAKURA (February 21, 1757-August 1, 1824) was a Japanese Kugyo (high court noble) in the mid to late Edo period.
Tomokazu IWAKURA (February 21, 1757-August 1, 1824) was a Japanese Kugyo (high court noble) in the mid to late Edo period.

sen.j: 岩倉家七世の祖。
sen.e: Founder of the seven generations of the Iwakura family.
Founder of the seven generations of the Iwakura family.
Founder of the seven generations of the Iwakura family.

sen.j: 篆刻を善くした。
sen.e: Enjoyed seal engraving.
Enjoyed seal engraving.
Enjoyed seal engraving.

sen.j: 公卿としては主に後桜町上皇に仕え、その院別当などを務めた。
sen.e: As a Kugyo, he mainly served the retired emperor Gosakuramachi and assumed positions of In no betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office) and others.
As a Kugyo, he mainly served the retired Emperor Gosakuramachi and assumed positions of In no betto (chief administrator of the retired Emperor's office) and others.
sen.cmt: 大文字化、小文字化しました。
sen.e: As a Kugyo, he mainly served the retired Emperor Gosakuramachi and assumed positions of In no betto (chief administrator of the retired Emperor's office) and others.

sen.j: 幼名を涼吉、のち家具（いえとも）と改め更に具選とした。
sen.e: His childhood name was Ryokichi, then Ietomo and finally changed into Tomokazu.
His childhood name was Ryokichi, then Ietomo and finally he changed his name into Tomokazu.
His childhood name was Ryokichi, then Ietomo and finally he changed his name into Tomokazu.

sen.j: 字は子訓、晩年に剃髪し可吸と号 (称号)した。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Shikun, and in his late years he became a monk and took a second name or alias of Kakyu.
His azana (adult male's nickname) was Shikun, and in his late years, he became a monk and called himself Kakyu.
sen.cmt: コンマ挿入、「号した」の表現変更しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Shikun, and in his late years, he became a monk and called himself Kakyu.

sen.j: 父は権大納言柳原光綱。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA.
His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA.
His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA.

sen.j: 正室は権大納言綾小路有美の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Gon Dainagon Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon Ariyoshi AYANOKOJI.

sen.j: 養父に治部大輔岩倉広選。
sen.e: His foster father was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) Hirokazu IWAKURA.
His adoptive father was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) Hirokazu IWAKURA.
His adoptive father was Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration) Hirokazu IWAKURA.

sen.j: 子に権大納言岩倉具集がいる。
sen.e: He had a child Gon Dainagon Tomoai IWAKURA.
He had a child, Gon Dainagon Tomoai IWAKURA.
He had a child, Gon Dainagon Tomoai IWAKURA.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 柳原光綱の末子で岩倉広雅の養子となる。
sen.e: Born as the youngest son of Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA and was adopted by Hiromasa IWAKURA.
Born as the youngest son of Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA and was adopted by Hiromasa IWAKURA.
Born as the youngest son of Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA and was adopted by Hiromasa IWAKURA.

sen.j: 宝暦13年（1763年）に叙爵。
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1763.
He was conferred peerage in 1763.
He was conferred peerage in 1763.

sen.j: 以降累進して、弾正少弼・侍従をへた。
sen.e: Since then he was promoted successfully, became danjo-shohitsu (junior assistant President of the Board of Censors) and jiju (a chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then he was promoted successfully, going through danjo-shohitsu (junior assistant President of the Board of Censors) and jiju (a chamberlain).
Since then he was promoted successfully, going through danjo-shohitsu (junior assistant President of the Board of Censors) and jiju (a chamberlain).

sen.j: 安永2年（1773年）には後桜町上皇の院伴官代となる。
sen.e: In 1773, he became the innobankandai of the retired emperor Gosakuramachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「院伴官代」は読み方不明。
sen.e: In 1773, he became innobankandai of the retired Emperor Gosakuramachi.
sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、大文字化しました。
sen.e: In 1773, he became innobankandai of the retired Emperor Gosakuramachi.

sen.j: 右近衛少将・近江介への任官を経て、安永9年（1780年）には上皇の信任を得て院別当へ昇格している。
sen.e: Having experienced Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and omi no suke (assistant governor of Omi Province), he was promoted to the In no betto in 1780 by gaining trust of the retired emperor.

Having experienced Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and omi no suke (assistant governor of Omi Province), he was promoted to In no betto in 1780 by gaining trust of the retired emperor.

Having experienced Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and omi no suke (assistant governor of Omi Province), he was promoted to In no betto in 1780 by gaining trust of the retired emperor.

sen.j: 天明8年（1788年）には従三位に達して公卿に列した。
sen.e: In 1788, he reached to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a member of Kugyo.
In 1788, he reached to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a member of Kugyo.
In 1788, he reached to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a member of Kugyo.

sen.j: しかし寛政8年（1796年）に蟄居となり、その翌年に落飾した。
sen.e: However in 1796, he was confined to his house and tonsured next year.
However in 1796, he was confined to his house and tonsured next year.
However in 1796, he was confined to his house and tonsured next year.

sen.j: 文学を好み、和歌・漢詩を善くした。
sen.e: He loved literature and enjoyed making waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and Chinese-style poems.
He loved literature and enjoyed making waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and Chinese-style poems.
He loved literature and enjoyed making waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and Chinese-style poems.

sen.j: また画を得意とし篆刻に巧みだった。
sen.e: Also he was good at painting and seal engraving.
Also he was good at painting and seal engraving.
Also he was good at painting and seal engraving.

sen.j: 篆刻は高芙蓉に師事。
sen.e: He learned seal engraving under Fuyo KO.
He learned seal engraving under Fuyo KO.
He learned seal engraving under Fuyo KO.

sen.j: その刻した印は『芙蓉山房私印譜』に掲載される。
sen.e: The seals he made were stamped in the "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu."
The seals he made appeared in the "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu."
The seals he made appeared in the "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu."

sen.j: 寛政5年（1793年）に『楷林』上下2冊を刊行した。
sen.e: In 1793, he published the two volumes of "Kairin."
In 1793, he published the two volumes of "Kairin."
In 1793, he published the two volumes of "Kairin."

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: Died at the age of 68.
Died at the age of 68.
Died at the age of 68.

sen.j: 京都出水通六軒町の清光寺に葬られた。
sen.e: He was buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Rokkencho, Demizu Street, Kyoto.
He was buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Rokkencho, Demizu Street, Kyoto.
He was buried in Seiko-ji Temple in Rokkencho, Demizu Street, Kyoto.
